file_content.text: Thanks for the rescue, Lieutenant. Make those Imps pay!
I'm Ensign Tane, sir. It's a good thing you found us--the scavengers were going to ship us off to some guy named "Needles" as soon as we healed up.
Needles? As in Ryler Dorant, the Havoc Squad medic?
I really don't know. "Needles" is all they ever called the guy. I figure it must be a code name, right?
It must be a code name or something. No way somebody is actually named "Needles."
"Needles" is a code name.
Yes, you're right.
Guess you've heard of him, then. The scavengers also said--
Are you absolutely sure they said "Needles"?
You're positive?
Yes, I'm one hundred percent sure. And I heard that--
Guess this wasn't a waste of time after all.
Just what I was looking for.
And that's not all. I also heard--
Here they are! Cav, Goran--cover the exit. Vise, Marko, Tabber--see to these men's wounds.
Oh, great. Sergeant Dorne's here to make sure we got stomped according to regulation.
Report, Ensign. Did you learn anything about the enemy?
Uh, yes, sir, Sergeant, sir. As I was just telling the lieutenant here, we were captured for some guy named Needles.
And get this: There are Imperials here, on Taris! They're working with this Needles guy in a hidden base out in the swamps.
Sounds like you overheard quite a bit.
You learned a lot.
Yes, sir, Lieutenant. The scavengers were pretty sloppy about talking in front of us.
These days, the Imps are everywhere.
I'm not surprised.
More bad news.
So, are you excited, Dorne? You'll finally have the chance to correct your old buddies' paperwork again!
This is no time for jokes, Ensign. Speak plainly.
What's that supposed to mean?
Uh, yes, sir, Lieutenant. Sorry, sir.
Is there something you want to tell me, Dorne?
"Old buddies," huh?
Many of the local troops feel that my adherence to regulations is a result of my upbringing, Lieutenant. I was born Imperial.
However, after two years' service in the Imperial military, I defected. Given my extensive knowledge and training, I was awarded this position under Service Code 37-R.
You made the right decision.
Good move.
What made you change sides?
Why defect?
The Imperials regularly violated their own stated regulations and intentions, without cause. I refused to participate.
I'm not happy that you hid this from me, Sergeant.
You should've told me.
The personal details I am required to disclose are clearly designated in Service Code 5, subsection three, Lieutenant.
We can discuss non-mission-critical issues later.
My team and I will get these men back to base, Lieutenant. You proceed with your mission against Needles and his Imperial installation.
I have the lead I was after. Time to act on it.
Agreed.
I'm glad I could help point you in the right direction, sir. Good luck.
Is there anything you want me to pass on to your old friends, Dorne?
Got any messages for the Imps?
We have our separate duties, Lieutenant. I'll leave you to yours.
Time to do some damage.
A strike now should catch the Imperials by surprise. Good luck, Lieutenant.
Whoa! Who are you? You took that thing down easy!
Commanding officer, Havoc Squad.
I'm Special Forces.
You're kidding. They actually sent Havoc Squad after us!
Report, soldier.
We're pretty banged up, sir, but we'll live. We were running our patrol route when these damned scavengers jumped us.
We can talk about how great I am later.
Save the praise.
Hey, you'd better believe I'm buying you a drink when we get back to base.
Ah! Look out!
You! You're from the Republic!
Watch out! There's a huge alien guarding us, and--
Ah! There it is! Run for it! Run!
Get us out of here!
I thought we were goners for sure.
That's Sergeant Dorne to you, Ensign.
Show some respect!
Are you referring to Ryler Dorant, the former Havoc Squad medic?
Don't be rude, Tane.
